metadata.title: Label
metadata.description: The label component represents a single text presented on the screen.

property.name: screen_text
property.value:
Double-Blind Treatment Period
Visit 3 Week 4 = Visit 2 Week 0 (Baseline) date + 28 days (± 5/± 1 days)
Visit 4 Week 8 = Visit 2 Week 0 (Baseline) date + 56 days (± 5/± 1 days)
Visit 5 Week 10 = Visit 2 Week 0 (Baseline) date + 70 days (± 5/± 1 days)
 
Visit window is ± 5 days for patients not on apheresis and ± 1 day for patients on apheresis. Every attempt should be made to ensure all samples are collected immediately prior to LDL apheresis. The timing between the baseline sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure should match the timing of the Week 12 sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure. Depending on the duration between the LDL apheresis procedure and sample collection, the visit window may not apply.
 
Visit 6 Week 12/End of Double-Blind Treatment = Visit 2 Week 0 (Baseline) date + 84 days (± 3/± 1 days)
 
Please note that Visit 6 Week 12/End of Double-Blind Treatment visit window is ± 3 days for patients not on apheresis and ± 1 day for patients on apheresis. Every attempt should be made to ensure all samples are collected immediately prior to LDL apheresis. The timing between the baseline sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure should match the timing of the Week 12 sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure. Depending on the duration between the LDL apheresis procedure and sample collection, the visit window may not apply.

Open-Label Treatment Period
Visit 7 Week 18 = Visit 2 Week 0 (Baseline) date + 126 days (± 7 days)
Visit 8 Week 24/End of Open-Label Treatment = Visit 2 Week 0 (Baseline) date + 168 days (± 3/± 1 days)
 
Please note that Visit 8 Week 24/End of Open-Label Treatment visit window is ± 3 days for patients not on apheresis and ± 1 day for patients on apheresis. Every attempt should be made to ensure all samples are collected immediately prior to LDL apheresis. The timing between the baseline sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure should match the timing of the Week 12 sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure. Depending on the duration between the LDL apheresis procedure and sample collection, the visit window may not apply.
 
Visit 9 Week 32/ End of Study Phone Visit = Visit 2 Week 0 (Baseline) date + 224 days (± 5 days)
 
Please note that Visit 9 Week 32/ End of Study Phone Visit is only for patients who do not participate in another lipid-lowering study.

property.name: screen_text
property.value:
Double-Blind Treatment Period
Visit 3 Week 4 = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+28,days"] (± 5/± 1 days)
Visit 4 Week 8 = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+56,days"] (± 5/± 1 days)
Visit 5 Week 10 = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+70,days"] (± 5/± 1 days)
 
Visit window is ± 5 days for patients not on apheresis and ± 1 day for patients on apheresis. Every attempt should be made to ensure all samples are collected immediately prior to LDL apheresis. The timing between the baseline sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure should match the timing of the Week 12 sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure. Depending on the duration between the LDL apheresis procedure and sample collection, the visit window may not apply.
 
Visit 6 Week 12 /End of Double-Blind Treatment = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+84,days"] (± 3/± 1 days)
 
Please note that Visit 6 Week 12/End of Double-Blind Treatment visit window is ± 3 days for patients not on apheresis and ± 1 day for patients on apheresis. Every attempt should be made to ensure all samples are collected immediately prior to LDL apheresis. The timing between the baseline sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure should match the timing of the Week 12 sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure. Depending on the duration between the LDL apheresis procedure and sample collection, the visit window may not apply.
 
Open-Label Treatment Period
Visit 7 Week 18 = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+126,days"] (± 7 days)
Visit 8 Week 24/End of Open-Label Treatment = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+168,days"] (± 3/± 1 days)
 
Please note that Visit 8 Week 24/End of Open-Label Treatment visit window is ± 3 days for patients not on apheresis and ± 1 day for patients on apheresis. Every attempt should be made to ensure all samples are collected immediately prior to LDL apheresis. The timing between the baseline sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure should match the timing of the Week 12 sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure. Depending on the duration between the LDL apheresis procedure and sample collection, the visit window may not apply.
 
Visit 9 Week 32/ End of Study Phone Visit = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+224,days"] (± 5 days)
 
Please note that Visit 9 Week 32/ End of Study Phone Visit is only for patients who do not participate in another lipid-lowering study.

property.name: screen_text
property.value:
Double-Blind Treatment Period
Visit 4 Week 8 = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+56,days"] (± 5/± 1 days)
Visit 5 Week 10 = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+70,days"] (± 5/± 1 days)
 
Visit window is ± 5 days for patients not on apheresis and ± 1 day for patients on apheresis. Every attempt should be made to ensure all samples are collected immediately prior to LDL apheresis. The timing between the baseline sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure should match the timing of the Week 12 sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure. Depending on the duration between the LDL apheresis procedure and sample collection, the visit window may not apply.
 
Visit 6 Week 12 /End of Double-Blind Treatment = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+84,days"] (± 3/± 1 days)
 
Please note that Visit 6 Week 12/End of Double-Blind Treatment visit window is ± 3 days for patients not on apheresis and ± 1 day for patients on apheresis. Every attempt should be made to ensure all samples are collected immediately prior to LDL apheresis. The timing between the baseline sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure should match the timing of the Week 12 sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure. Depending on the duration between the LDL apheresis procedure and sample collection, the visit window may not apply.
 
Open-Label Treatment Period
Visit 7 Week 18 = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+126,days"] (± 7 days)
Visit 8 Week 24/End of Open-Label Treatment = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+168,days"] (± 3/± 1 days)
 
Please note that Visit 8 Week 24/End of Open-Label Treatment visit window is ± 3 days for patients not on apheresis and ± 1 day for patients on apheresis. Every attempt should be made to ensure all samples are collected immediately prior to LDL apheresis. The timing between the baseline sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure should match the timing of the Week 12 sample collection relative to the most recently completed LDL apheresis procedure. Depending on the duration between the LDL apheresis procedure and sample collection, the visit window may not apply.
 
Visit 9 Week 32/ End of Study Phone Visit = [date type="start" format="dd/MMM/yyyy" calculation="+224,days"] (± 5 days) 
 
Please note that Visit 9 Week 32/ End of Study Phone Visit is only for patients who do not participate in another lipid-lowering study.

metadata.title: Label
metadata.description: The label component represents a single text presented on the screen.

property.name: screen_text
property.value: Please note that if for any reason the patient refuses to continue the study, the patient should undergo an unscheduled visit as soon as possible with assessments normally planned at the End of Double-Blind Treatment visit if the patient is in the Double-Blind Treatment period (Week 12 visit assessments); if the patient is in the Open-Label Treatment visit, then the End of Open-Label Treatment assessments should be used (Week 24 visit assessments). This visit should take place within 5 days of treatment discontinuation, if possible. The patient should be followed for at least 70 days from the last dose of study drug or up to recovery or stabilization of any AE to be followed up as specified in this protocol, whichever comes last.
